content.4: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots
content.5: They were driven forth from among
content.6: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys,
content.7: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
content.9: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.
content.10: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.
content.11: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
content.13: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.
content.15: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
content.16: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
content.17: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.
content.19: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
content.20: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me
content.21: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
content.22: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride
content.24: Howbeit he will not stretch out
content.25: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was
content.26: When I looked for good, then evil came
content.27: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.
content.28: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up,
content.29: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
content.30: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
